briefdescription.para: Constructor for LMNNFunction class.

Evaluate the LMNN function for the given transformation matrix.

detaileddescription.para: This is the non-separable implementation, where the objective function is not decomposed into the sum of several objective functions.

parameterdescription.para: Transformation matrix of Mahalanobis distance.

memberdef.name: Evaluate

briefdescription.para: Evaluate the LMNN objective function for the given transformation matrix on the given batch size from a given inital point of the dataset.

detaileddescription.para: This is the separable implementation, where the objective function is decomposed into the sum of many objective functions, and here, only one of those constituent objective functions is returned.

parameterdescription.para: Transformation matrix of Mahalanobis distance.
Index of the initial point to use for objective function.
Number of points to use for objective function.

memberdef.argsstring: (const arma::mat &transformation, const size_t begin, GradType &gradient, const size_t batchSize=1)
memberdef.name: EvaluateWithGradient

briefdescription.para: Evaluate the LMNN objective function together with gradient for the given transformation matrix on the given batch size, from a given initial point of the dataset.

detaileddescription.para: This is the separable implementation, where the objective function is decomposed into the sum of many objective functions, and here, only one of those constituent objective functions is returned. The type of the gradient parameter is a template argument to allow the computation of a sparse gradient.

parameterdescription.para: The type of the gradient out-param.
Transformation matrix of Mahalanobis distance.
Index of the initial point to use for objective function.
Matrix to store the calculated gradient in.
Number of points to use for objective function.

parameterdescription.para: The type of the gradient out-param.

Matrix to store the calculated gradient in.

briefdescription.para: Return the initial point for the optimization.

memberdef.name: Gradient

briefdescription.para: Evaluate the gradient of the LMNN function for the given transformation matrix on the given batch size, from a given initial point of the dataset.

detaileddescription.para: This is the separable implementation, where the objective function is decomposed into the sum of many objective functions, and here, only one of those constituent objective functions is returned. The type of the gradient parameter is a template argument to allow the computation of a sparse gradient.

parameterdescription.para: The type of the gradient out-param.
Transformation matrix of Mahalanobis distance.
Index of the initial point to use for objective function.
Matrix to store the calculated gradient in.

parameterdescription.para: The type of the gradient out-param.

memberdef.name: UpdateCache

briefdescription.para: Update cache transformation matrices.
The Large Margin Nearest Neighbors function.

para.formula: $ \epsilon(M) = \sum_{ij}\eta_{ij}|| L x_i - L x_j ||^2 + c\sum_{ijl}\eta_{ij}(1-y_{il})[1 + || L x_i - L x_j ||^2 - || L x_i - L x_l ||^2)]_{+} $

detaileddescription.para: where x_n represents a point and A is the current scaling matrix.

This class is more flexible than the original paper, allowing an arbitrary metric function to be used in place of || A x_i - A x_j ||^2, meaning that the squared Euclidean distance is not the only allowed metric for LMNN. However, that is probably the best way to use this class.

In addition to the standard Evaluate() and Gradient() functions which mlpack optimizers use, overloads of Evaluate() and Gradient() are given which only operate on one point in the dataset. This is useful for optimizers like stochastic gradient descent (see ens::SGD).
